body:
It's up to date in terms of the files that are advertised in the cluster, all of those files are in sync. 

Sure, perhaps there are some local files, but does that make it out of date with the rest of the cluster? 

It's debatable hence I think this should start on the forum rather than the bug tracker, as it's not obvious what the right behaviour is, and the fact that your view is that it's wrong does immediately turn it into a bug.

Folders are same as i manually copy from master to backup.
But button "revert local changes" never dissapears.

Folders of sync are absolutely identicall, even the date of change and creation of the each file.

I pushed button  "revert local changes" many times, do restarts, do again copies, but all the same.

![222](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10881942/63635832-d6dd2f00-c66f-11e9-8b72-784f4aecbfe0.png)

@MasterDimmy  The revert button not working has nothing to do with this issue. Please open a thread on the forum so we can try to figure out what's going on and once we do, open a new ticket regarding that.

> 
> 
> @MasterDimmy The revert button not working has nothing to do with this issue. Please open a thread on the forum so we can try to figure out what's going on and once we do, open a new ticket regarding that.

What is the link to the forum?
Its a really annoying bug

issue.title: Indication about locally added items in web UI

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

labels.name: skip-changelog
labels.description: Bugs that have never been in a released stable version, and as such excluded from the release notes

issue.body:
This is essentially just a reminder about https://forum.syncthing.net/t/status-of-folder-with-pending-revert-local-changes, as I already forgot it existed:

On a receive-only folder, if you create files locally, the folder stays up-to-date. This is correct, however there's no indication in the UI that there is something to revert. The following proposition in the forum seems to have been received well:

> As I see it the issue with “up to date” is not that it’s incorrect in meaning, but that there is no indication in the web UI that there is something to revert. That’s why I’d be in favor of adding “local additions” (as “local changes” is misleading as explained above by Audrius). In terms of color I’d say stay the same as up-to-date, as it is up-to-date.

issue.title: gui: New folder state "Local Additions" for receive-only (fixes #5968)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
### Purpose

See #5968 and https://forum.syncthing.net/t/status-of-folder-with-pending-revert-local-changes for previous discussions about wording/meaning. "Local Additions" was chosen as this state only occurs, when the folder is up-to-date except for locally added/changed files that weren't changed on any remotes. Otherwise out-of-sync still applies.

### Testing

Manual

### Screenshots

![Screenshot_2019-11-01_09-35-23](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15955093/68012843-7976e700-fc8b-11e9-8115-3e2309e33440.png)
